name: Garlic Naan
history: Garlic Naan is a variation of the classic Naan bread, popular in Indian cuisine. Infused with garlic, this flatbread has gained popularity for its aromatic flavor and is often served in restaurants and households alike.
description: Garlic Naan is a soft, leavened flatbread made from all-purpose flour and flavored with garlic. It is cooked on a hot surface and typically brushed with butter or ghee, offering a delightful combination of soft texture and rich, garlicky taste.

equipment.name: cast iron skillet or heavy pan

instructions.title: Prepare the Dough
instructions.description: Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water. In a mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour, salt, yeast mixture, yogurt, milk, and minced garlic. Knead into a soft dough. Cover and let it rise until doubled in size.

instructions.title: Roll and Cook Naan
instructions.description: Divide the dough into balls. Roll each ball into an oval shape. Heat a cast iron skillet or heavy pan. Cook each naan until it puffs up and brown spots appear, then flip and cook the other side. Brush with ghee or butter.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the garlic naan warm with your choice of curry, dal, or other Indian dishes.

tips: The dough should be soft and pliable for the best texture.
Fresh garlic imparts a more intense flavor than garlic powder.
variations: Top with chopped cilantro or sesame seeds before serving for added flavor and texture.
Experiment with stuffed garlic naan fillings like cheese or spiced potatoes.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh. Can be stored in an airtight container for up to 1 day.
storage.instructions: Reheat on a skillet before serving if stored.

reheatingInstructions.instruction: Reheat on a skillet or in a microwave until warm.

presentationTips: Serve on a platter with a side of mint chutney or yogurt.
Garnish with a sprinkle of fresh cilantro or a wedge of lemon.
